oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WAVES GENERATED BY TWO OR MORE SHIPS IN A CHANNEL
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nascimento, Maria Francisca
Neves, Claudio Freitas
Maciel, Geraldo de Freitas
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ship waves
Boussinesq waves
wave refraction
wave-wave interaction
orbital velocities
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The numerical model FUNWAVE+Ship simulates the generation and propagation of ship waves to shore, including phenomena such as refraction, diffraction, currents and breaking of waves. The interaction of two wave trains, generated by ships moving either in the same direction at different speeds or in opposite directions, is studied. Focus is given to the wave orbital velocities and to the free surface pattern.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 32 (2010): Proceedings of 32nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Shanghai, China, 2010.; waves.60
